top_rare_diseases.description: A group of diseases caused by the accumulation of amyloid, an abnormal protein, in tissues and organs.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Amyloidosis is a rare, often fatal disease caused by the accumulation of amyloid fibrils in various tissues and organs. It can affect multiple organ systems, including the kidneys, heart, liver, and nerves.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Amyloidosis can lead to organ failure, particularly kidney failure, if left untreated.
top_rare_diseases.causes: It is caused by mutations in various genes, leading to the production of abnormal proteins that form amyloid fibrils.

diagnosis.biopsy: Tissue biopsy is the gold standard for diagnosis

clinical_trials: Evaluating the Efficacy of a Novel Chemotherapy Regimen in Amyloidosis Patients
Assessing the Safety and Tolerability of a New Amyloid-Targeting Drug

top_rare_diseases.description: A genetic disorder characterized by kidney disease, hearing loss, and eye abnormalities.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Alport syndrome is a rare genetic disorder that primarily affects the kidneys, leading to progressive kidney disease. It can also cause hearing loss and eye abnormalities.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Alport syndrome often leads to end-stage renal disease (ESRD), requiring dialysis or kidney transplantation.
top_rare_diseases.causes: It is caused by mutations in genes that code for type IV collagen, which is essential for kidney function.

treatment.medications: ACE inhibitors for blood pressure control

clinical_trials: Investigating ACE Inhibitor Efficacy in Alport Syndrome
Assessing Bone Marrow Transplant Outcomes in Alport Patients
key_aspects: Genetic testing is essential for diagnosis

top_rare_diseases.description: An autoimmune kidney disease characterized by the deposition of IgA antibodies in the glomeruli.
top_rare_diseases.overview: IgA Nephropathy, also known as Berger's disease, is an autoimmune disorder that causes inflammation in the kidney's glomeruli, leading to impaired kidney function.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: IgA Nephropathy can progress to chronic kidney disease and potentially require dialysis or kidney transplantation.
top_rare_diseases.causes: It is caused by an abnormal immune response leading to the deposition of IgA antibodies in the kidneys.

diagnosis.biopsy: Kidney biopsy is the gold standard

clinical_trials: Evaluating the Effectiveness of a New Immunosuppressive Drug in IgA Nephropathy
Assessing the Impact of Fish Oil on Disease Progression
key_aspects: Early interventions can slow disease progression
Regular monitoring of kidney function is necessary

top_rare_diseases.description: A rare cystic kidney disease that leads to progressive kidney failure.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Nephronophthisis is a rare genetic disorder causing cystic changes in the kidneys, leading to progressive kidney failure, typically manifesting in childhood or adolescence.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: It often leads to end-stage renal disease (ESRD), requiring dialysis or kidney transplant.
top_rare_diseases.causes: It is caused by mutations in genes critical for kidney development and function.

treatment.medications: ACE inhibitors for blood pressure control

clinical_trials: Investigating a Novel Gene Therapy Approach for Nephronophthisis
Evaluating the Impact of ACE Inhibitors on Disease Progression
key_aspects: Genetic testing is essential for diagnosis

top_rare_diseases.description: A genetic disorder caused by the deficiency of the enzyme alpha-Galactosidase A, leading to the accumulation of globotriaosylsphingosine.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Fabry disease is a rare X-linked genetic disorder that results in the accumulation of a specific lipid in cells, leading to multiorgan dysfunction, particularly affecting the kidneys, heart, and nervous system.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Fabry disease can lead to kidney failure, heart disease, and increased risk of stroke.
top_rare_diseases.causes: It is caused by mutations in the GLA gene, affecting the production of alpha-Galactosidase A enzyme.

diagnosis.biopsy: Skin or kidney biopsy may be performed

treatment.supportive-care: Pain management, Cardiac and renal monitoring

clinical_trials: Evaluating the Efficacy of a Novel ERT in Fabry Disease
Assessing the Impact of Chaperone Therapy on Disease Progression
